title: What is the probability that a woman will be elected as the President of the United States between 2024 and 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, between January 20, 2025, and January 20, 2031, a woman is inaugurated as the President of the United States. The resolution will be based on the official inauguration records provided by the U.S. National Archives or any other authoritative governmental source. In the event of a dispute regarding the election outcome, the question will resolve based on the decision of the U.S. Supreme Court. If a woman assumes the presidency without an inauguration due to unforeseen circumstances (e.g., succession following the incapacitation or death of a sitting president), this will also result in a Yes resolution, provided that she serves as president for at least 24 hours.

title: What is the probability that the United Kingdom will have a new Prime Minister by January 1, 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by January 1, 2028, an individual other than the current Prime Minister as of the date of this question's creation is officially serving as the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom. The change in leadership must be confirmed by an official announcement from the UK government or a reputable news source such as the BBC. Interim or acting Prime Ministers will count towards resolution only if they are officially carrying out the duties of the Prime Minister and are not merely temporary placeholders during a brief transition period. In the event of a dispute over the legitimacy of the leadership change, the resolution will be based on the recognition by the UK Parliament. If the current Prime Minister is re-elected or re-appointed after a general election or a party leadership contest, this will not count as a 'new' Prime Minister for the purposes of this question.

title: What is the probability that Angela Merkel will no longer be the Chancellor of Germany by the end of 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Angela Merkel is not serving as the Chancellor of Germany at any point from the start of the year 2028 until the end of the year 2028. The resolution will be based on official statements from the German Federal Government or credible news sources confirming that Angela Merkel has ceased to hold the office of Chancellor, whether due to resignation, impeachment, term limits, or any other reason. In the event of temporary incapacitation or delegation of duties without formal resignation, the question will not resolve as Yes unless the incapacitation or delegation spans the entirety of the year 2028. If Angela Merkel's status as Chancellor is contested or unclear due to political or legal disputes, the question will resolve based on the de facto control of the office as recognized by the majority of EU member states.

title: What is the probability that Emmanuel Macron will be re-elected as President of France in 2027?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Emmanuel Macron is officially declared the winner of the French presidential election of 2027 by the Constitutional Council of France. The resolution will be based on the official results as published by the French Ministry of the Interior. In the event of a dispute or a recount, the question will resolve after the final decision is made by the Constitutional Council. If Emmanuel Macron does not run, withdraws his candidacy, or is otherwise ineligible to serve as President by the date of the election, the question will resolve as No.

title: What is the probability that Matteo Renzi will become the Prime Minister of Italy between 2024 and 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Matteo Renzi is appointed and serves as the Prime Minister of Italy at any point between January 1, 2024, and December 31, 2030. The appointment must be officially recognized by the Italian government, and the individual must be Matteo Renzi himself, not a person with a similar name or a stand-in. The resolution will be based on credible reports from major news outlets, official government press releases, or direct confirmation from the Italian government. In the event of a dispute over the identity of the Prime Minister, the resolution will default to the official records of the Italian government. If Matteo Renzi is appointed Prime Minister but does not take office due to unforeseen circumstances (e.g., illness, resignation prior to inauguration), the question will resolve as No unless he officially holds the title and performs the duties of Prime Minister, even if only for a brief period.

title: What is the probability of the Democratic Party holding the majority in the U.S. Senate after the 2022 midterm elections?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, following the 2022 U.S. midterm elections, the Democratic Party holds a majority of seats in the U.S. Senate. The resolution will be based on the official post-election results published by the Federal Election Commission or other authoritative governmental sources. In cases where Senate seats are contested, the resolution will be based on the final certified results. Any changes in party affiliations post-election will not affect the resolution.

title: What is the probability that California will elect a Republican Governor in the 2022 gubernatorial election?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if a Republican candidate wins the gubernatorial election in California in 2022. The resolution will be based on the official election results certified by the California Secretary of State. If the election results are subject to legal challenges or recounts, the question will resolve after all legal processes are concluded. The question will not consider changes in party affiliations post-election.

title: What is the probability that the U.S. Congress will pass a comprehensive infrastructure bill by the end of 2021?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if a comprehensive infrastructure bill is passed by both the U.S. House of Representatives and the U.S. Senate and signed into law by the President before January 1, 2022. The resolution will be based on official announcements from the U.S. Congress and the White House regarding the passage and signing of the bill. Any versions of the bill that do not meet the criteria of comprehensive infrastructure legislation will not count towards resolution.

title: What is the probability that a third-party candidate will win any state in the U.S. presidential election of 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if a third-party candidate wins the electoral votes of at least one state in the U.S. presidential election of 2024. The resolution will be based on the official results reported by the Federal Election Commission and state electoral bodies. Only electoral victories, not popular vote outcomes, will determine resolution.

title: What is the probability that the U.S. Congress will pass a bipartisan immigration reform bill before the end of 2023?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if a bipartisan immigration reform bill, with significant support from both major political parties, is passed by both the U.S. House of Representatives and the U.S. Senate and signed into law by the President before January 1, 2024. The resolution will be based on official information from the U.S. Congress and the White House regarding the passage and signing of the bill. Any bills passed without bipartisan support or not specifically focused on immigration reform will not count towards resolution.

title: What is the probability that Andrew Cuomo will run for President of the United States in 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Andrew Cuomo officially declares his candidacy for the 2024 U.S. presidential election. The resolution will be based on an official announcement from Andrew Cuomo or his campaign team. Any exploratory committees or informal statements will not count towards resolution.

title: What is the probability that Kamala Harris will run for President of the United States in 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Kamala Harris officially declares her candidacy for the 2028 U.S. presidential election. The resolution will be based on an official announcement from Kamala Harris or her campaign team. Any exploratory committees or informal statements will not count towards resolution.

title: What is the probability that Bernie Sanders will run for President of the United States in 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Bernie Sanders officially declares his candidacy for the 2024 U.S. presidential election. The resolution will be based on an official announcement from Bernie Sanders or his campaign team. Any exploratory committees or informal statements will not count towards resolution.

title: What is the probability that a non-binary candidate will run for President of the United States in 2032?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if a non-binary candidate officially declares their candidacy for the 2032 U.S. presidential election. The resolution will be based on an official announcement from the candidate or their campaign team. Any exploratory committees or informal statements will not count towards resolution.

title: What is the probability that the Green Party will win any state in the U.S. presidential election of 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the Green Party candidate wins the electoral votes of at least one state in the U.S. presidential election of 2024. The resolution will be based on the official results reported by the Federal Election Commission and state electoral bodies. Only electoral victories, not popular vote outcomes, will determine resolution.

title: What is the probability that Joe Biden will seek re-election as President of the United States in 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Joe Biden officially declares his candidacy for re-election in the 2024 U.S. presidential election. The resolution will be based on an official announcement from Joe Biden or his campaign team. Any exploratory committees or informal statements will not count towards resolution.

title: What is the probability that a Republican candidate will win the U.S. presidential election in 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if a Republican candidate wins the U.S. presidential election in 2024. The resolution will be based on the official election results certified by the Federal Election Commission. Any legal challenges or recounts will be considered before resolution.
